comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Possibly Colonel Mortimer Delano, "of the State Aviation Corps and secretary of the Aero Club of America" according to New-York tribune., February 14, 1914, Page 2, Image 2 (right-hand column). chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1914-02-14/ed-...

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq:  Thanks for letting us know who this may be.  We'll include your info. in the description next time we update.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: New-York tribune. (New York [N.Y.]) 1866-1924, October 09, 1913, Image 6 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1913-10-09/ed-... has a picture with Mortimer Delano (he's at left). It could be the same person.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mortimer_Delano He was in the news in 1914 for selling military sounding titles and selling aviation uniforms though his organizations. The flight training equivalent of a modern "diploma mill".
